questions: How many books can I borrow?
entries.answer:
**Borrowing Limits:**

**For Students:**
â¢ Maximum books: 5
â¢ Loan period: 14 days
â¢ Renewals allowed: 1 time (if no holds)

**For Staff:**
â¢ Maximum books: 10
â¢ Loan period: 30 days
â¢ Renewals allowed: 2 times

**Overdue Items:**
â¢ Fine: â¦50 per day per book
â¢ Maximum fine: â¦1000 per book
â¢ Borrowing privileges suspended until fines paid

questions: What services does the library offer?
Can I print in the library?
entries.answer:
**Library Services:**

1. **Borrowing Services** - Books, journals, media
2. **Research Assistance** - Librarian consultations
3. **Printing & Copying** - B&W (â¦10/page), Color (â¦50/page)
4. **WiFi Access** - 'Babcock-Library' network
5. **Study Spaces** - Quiet zones, group study rooms
6. **Computer Lab** - 50+ computers with internet
7. **Database Access** - 50+ academic databases
8. **Interlibrary Loan** - Request materials from other libraries
9. **Reference Desk** - Research and citation help
10. **Workshops** - Regular training sessions

questions: How do I find a book?
entries.answer:
**Finding Books in the Library:**

1. **Search Online Catalog:**
   â¢ Visit library website
   â¢ Use search box
   â¢ Filter by author, title, subject

2. **Understand Call Numbers:**
   â¢ Books organized by Library of Congress system
   â¢ Example: QA76.73.P98 (Computer Science section)

3. **Locate in Library:**
   â¢ Ground Floor: Reference, New Arrivals
   â¢ 1st Floor: Social Sciences, Humanities
   â¢ 2nd Floor: Sciences, Engineering
   â¢ 3rd Floor: Quiet Study, Special Collections

4. **Get Help:**
   â¢ Ask at circulation desk
   â¢ Use library floor maps
   â¢ Request librarian assistance

**Digital Resources Available:**

**Databases (On-campus):**
â¢ JSTOR - Arts & Sciences
â¢ IEEE Xplore - Engineering
â¢ ScienceDirect - Science
â¢ SpringerLink - Multidisciplinary
â¢ PubMed - Medicine
â¢ ACM Digital Library - Computing
â¢ ProQuest - Dissertations & Theses

**E-Book Collections:**
â¢ EBSCO eBooks
â¢ Springer eBooks
â¢ O'Reilly Learning

**Remote Access:**
Use your Babcock University credentials to access all digital resources from anywhere.

**Research Guides:**
Subject-specific guides available on library website.

**Library Facilities:**

**Ground Floor:**
â¢ Circulation Desk
â¢ Reference Collection
â¢ New Arrivals
â¢ Group Study Rooms (Bookable)
â¢ Computer Lab (50+ PCs)
â¢ Printing/Copying Station

**First Floor:**
â¢ Social Sciences Collection
â¢ Humanities Collection
â¢ Quiet Study Area
â¢ Current Periodicals

**Second Floor:**
â¢ Sciences Collection
â¢ Engineering Collection
â¢ Quiet Study Carrels
â¢ Thesis Collection

**Third Floor:**
â¢ Special Collections
â¢ Archives
â¢ Silent Study Zone
â¢ Faculty Research Area

**Other Facilities:**
â¢ WiFi throughout building
â¢ Drinking water stations
â¢ Restrooms on each floor
â¢ Elevator access
â¢ Wheelchair accessible

**Library Membership:**

**Primary Users (Automatic Membership):**
â¢ All Babcock University students
â¢ All Babcock University staff
â¢ Use your university ID as library card

**Secondary Users (With Conditions):**
â¢ Alumni: Free access with alumni card
â¢ Visiting scholars: Letter from department required
â¢ Consortium members: Reciprocal agreement

**Guest Users:**
â¢ Limited access to physical collection
â¢ No borrowing privileges
â¢ Internet access: â¦500/day

**All users must:**
â¢ Register at circulation desk
â¢ Follow library rules and regulations
â¢ Respect quiet study areas

**Getting Research Help:**

1. **Research Consultations:**
   â¢ Book appointment with subject librarian
   â¢ 30-60 minute sessions
   â¢ Help with search strategies, databases, citations

2. **Research Guides:**
   â¢ Subject-specific guides on library website
   â¢ Database recommendations
   â¢ Citation style guides

3. **Workshops:**
   â¢ Database training sessions
   â¢ Citation management (Zotero/Mendeley)
   â¢ Research skills development

4. **Online Help:**
   â¢ Live chat with librarian
   â¢ Email research questions
   â¢ Video tutorials on website

5. **Citation Help:**
   â¢ Style guides at reference desk
   â¢ Online citation generators
   â¢ Individual consultation available

**Library Rules & Conduct:**

**General Conduct:**
â¢ Respect quiet study areas
â¢ Keep conversations at low volume
â¢ Use cell phones in designated areas only
â¢ No disruptive behavior

**Food & Drink:**
â¢ Covered drinks allowed
â¢ Snacks allowed in cafeteria only
â¢ No hot meals in study areas
â¢ Clean up after yourself

**Resource Use:**
â¢ Handle library materials carefully
â¢ Return books on time
â¢ Report damaged items
â¢ No marking in books

**Computer Use:**
â¢ Academic purposes priority
â¢ No inappropriate websites
â¢ Save files to personal devices
â¢ Log out when finished

**Violations may result in:**
â¢ Warning
â¢ Temporary suspension
â¢ Loss of privileges
â¢ Disciplinary action
